kb.title: Knowledge Base
kb.mainSubheader: Find answers to your questions and learn how to use the system.

overview.title: Application Overview
overview.content: LoungeOS is a comprehensive management solution designed for your lounge, restaurant, or bar. It includes modules for Point of Sale (POS), Inventory Management, Staff Management, Reporting, Accounting and more. This knowledge base will guide you through its features.

roles.title: Understanding User Roles
roles.content:
The system has several user roles, each with specific permissions:
- Super Admin: Full access to everything. Ideal for initial setup and system configuration.
- Manager: Access to most daily operations, including staff and inventory management, reports, accounting and all operational views.
- Accountant: Focused on financial management. Has full access to the accounting module and can view reports and operational data.
- Stock Manager: A specialized role to manage inventory, suppliers, and view meals.
- Chef: Access to the kitchen display to manage food orders.
- Waiter: Takes orders and manages tables on their assigned floor via the Tables and POS views.
- Cashier: Processes payments via the POS interface and can view the bar display.
- Bartender: Manages drink orders via the bar display.

firstLogin.title: First Time Login
firstLogin.content: When a new staff member is created, an initial password ('password' for seeded users, or automatically generated for others) is set. Upon their first login, they will be required to set a new, private password to secure their account.

takingOrders.title: How to Take an Order
takingOrders.content:
1. Go to the 'Tables' view from the sidebar.
2. Click on an 'Available' (green) table. This will take you to the POS page.
3. In the POS, add items to the order by clicking on them in the product grid.
4. Adjust quantities in the 'Current Order' panel on the right.
5. Click 'Place Order' to send it to the kitchen and/or bar. The order will be split automatically between the two displays based on the item's category (food or drink).

managingOrders.title: How to View or Modify an Existing Order
managingOrders.content:
1. From the 'Tables' view, click on an 'Occupied' (red) table.
2. The POS page will load with the active order for that table.
3. You can add more items and click 'Place Order' again to update it.
4. Alternatively, Managers can go to the 'Orders' page to see a list of all orders and click 'View Details' to modify items or quantities.

processingPayments.title: How to Process a Payment
processingPayments.content:
1. In the POS view for an active order, click 'Charge Order'.
2. Select the payment method (Cash, Card, Mobile).
3. If cash, enter the amount tendered to calculate the change.
4. Click 'Confirm Payment' to complete the transaction.
5. The system will then give you the option to print a receipt. The table's status will automatically be set back to 'Available'.

splitMerge.title: How to Split or Merge Orders
splitMerge.content:
For complex situations, managers can split or merge orders:
1. Go to the 'Orders' page and open the details for an active order.
2. To Split: Click 'Split Order', select the items to move, and a new order will be created with them.
3. To Merge: Click 'Merge Order' and select another active order to combine it with. The items will be moved, and the original order will be removed.

kds.title: Using the Kitchen Display System (KDS)
kds.content:
The KDS ('Kitchen' in the sidebar) shows all incoming food orders.
- New orders appear in the 'Pending' column.
- Drag an order to the 'In Progress' column to start working on it, or click 'Start Cooking'.
- Once done, drag it to 'Ready' or click 'Mark as Ready'. A notification sound will play, and the order will move to the 'Ready' column until it's paid for at the POS.

bds.title: Using the Bar Display System (BDS)
bds.content:
The BDS ('Bar' in the sidebar) works exactly like the KDS but only for drink items.
- Drag orders between columns ('Pending' -> 'In Progress' -> 'Ready') to update their status.
- This allows bartenders to manage their queue independently of the kitchen.

cancelOrder.title: Cancelling an Order from KDS/BDS
cancelOrder.content: If an order needs to be cancelled, simply drag the order card to the 'Drag here to Cancel' zone that appears at the bottom of the screen. You will be asked to confirm the cancellation.

managingMeals.title: How to Manage Meals
managingMeals.content:
1. Go to the 'Meals' page.
2. Here you can add, edit, or delete the finished products you sell (e.g., 'Beef Burger').
3. Set the name, price, category, and available quantity. The quantity is important; if it's zero, the item cannot be sold.
4. You can also upload a picture for the POS grid.

managingIngredients.title: How to Manage Ingredients
managingIngredients.content:
1. Go to the 'Inventory' page.
2. This section is for raw materials (e.g., 'Tomatoes', 'Flour').
3. Track stock levels here. The system will alert you when stock is low (below 10 units) or out.

csv.title: Importing & Exporting via CSV
csv.content:
On both the 'Meals' and 'Inventory' pages, you can use the 'File Actions' button to manage products in bulk.
- 'Download Template' gives you a correctly formatted CSV file.
- Fill it out and use 'Import from CSV' to add many items at once.

floorsTables.title: How to Manage Floors and Tables
floorsTables.content:
1. To create or delete service areas (e.g., 'VIP Lounge', 'Terrace'), go to the 'Floor Management' page and click 'Manage Floors'.
2. To add new tables, go to the 'Tables' page and click 'Add Table'. You must assign each new table to a floor.
3. To assign existing tables or staff to a floor, go to 'Floor Management' and use the dropdowns on each floor's card.

staff.title: How to Manage Staff
staff.content:
1. Go to the 'Staff' page.
2. Click 'Add Staff Member' to create a new user account. Assign a role (like Manager, Waiter, or Accountant) and, if necessary, a floor.
3. The new user will be forced to change their password on first login.
4. Use the action menu on any staff member to edit details, reset their password, activate/deactivate their account, or delete their account.

categories.title: How to Manage Categories
categories.content: Go to the 'Categories' page to create or delete categories for your meals. This helps organize the POS grid for faster order taking. When creating a category, be sure to check 'This is a food category' if it's for edible items, as this controls whether orders are sent to the kitchen or the bar.

overview.title: Accounting Overview
overview.content: The Accounting module is designed for Managers, Super Admins, and Accountants to track the financial health of the business. It provides high-level summaries and detailed transactional records.

dashboard.title: Using the Accounting Dashboard
dashboard.content: The main accounting dashboard gives you a snapshot of your finances, including Net Profit, Total Revenue, and Total Expenses. The Revenue vs Expenses chart helps you visualize performance over time. Use the Quick Actions to jump to detailed journals or reports.

journals.title: Understanding Financial Journals
journals.content:
Journals are detailed logs of all financial transactions.
- Sales Journal: Automatically populated with every completed order, showing revenue generated.
- Expenses Journal: Manually log all business costs here, such as rent, salaries, or supplier payments.
- General Ledger: A master log combining all sales and expenses, providing a complete financial history.

configuration.title: How to Configure the System
configuration.content:
The 'Configuration' page is where Super Admins and Managers can customize the application:
- General: Change the platform name, logo, and organization details.
- Appearance: Create new visual themes and switch between them.
- Receipt: Customize the layout and content of printed receipts and invoices.
- Login Screen: Change the background images that appear on the login page carousel.

backup.title: Backup & Restore
backup.content:
The 'Backup & Restore' page is crucial for data safety.
- 'Manual Backup': Click to download a complete, encrypted snapshot of all your application data (orders, staff, products, etc.). Store this file securely.
- 'Restore from Backup': If needed, you can upload a backup file here to restore the system to a previous state. WARNING: This overwrites all current data.

activityLog.title: Viewing the Activity Log
activityLog.content: The 'Activity Log' page provides an audit trail of important actions taken in the system, such as user logins, staff creation/deletion, and data imports. This is useful for security and monitoring.

creating.title: How to Create a Support Ticket
creating.content:
1. Go to the 'Support' page from the sidebar.
2. Click 'Create New Ticket'.
3. Fill in the form with a clear title, a detailed description, and set the priority and category.
4. Click 'Submit Ticket'. Your ticket will be visible to you and to management.

managing.title: How to Manage Tickets (for Managers)
managing.content:
As a Manager or Super Admin, you can view all tickets on the Support page. Click on any ticket to open the details view, where you can:
- Change the ticket's status (e.g., from 'Open' to 'In Progress').
- Assign the ticket to a specific staff member for resolution.
- Add comments to communicate with the ticket creator and document progress.

1.title: Welcome to the Dashboard!
1.description:
This is your main overview of the lounge's performance.

Here you can see key metrics like revenue, orders, and top-selling products at a glance.

2.title: Key Performance Indicators (KPIs)
2.description: These cards at the top show your most important metrics in real-time. Keep an eye on them to monitor your business health.

3.title: Navigation
3.description: Use the sidebar on the left to navigate to different sections of the application, such as the Point of Sale (POS), Inventory, or Staff Management.

1.title: Table Management View
1.description:
This is the central hub for waiters and cashiers.

Each card represents a table in your establishment, color-coded by its status.

2.title: Taking an Order
2.description: To start a new order, simply click on an 'Available' (green) table. This will take you to the Point of Sale page with that table pre-selected.

3.title: Managing an Existing Order
3.description: To add items or check on an existing order, click on an 'Occupied' (red) table. This will load the table's current order in the POS.

4.title: Managing Layout (Admins)
4.description: If you are a Manager or Admin, you can use the buttons at the top right to add new tables or manage your service areas (Floors).

1.title: Point of Sale (POS)
1.description: This is where you'll build customer orders. The selected table is shown at the top right.

2.title: Adding Products
2.description: Click on any product from the grid on the left to add it to the 'Current Order' summary on the right. You can switch categories using the tabs at the top.

3.title: Placing & Charging
3.description:
Once the order is complete, use the buttons at the bottom right:
- 'Place Order' sends the items to the kitchen/bar.
- 'Charge Order' opens the payment dialog to finalize the bill.

1.title: Staff Management
1.description: This page allows you to manage all user accounts for your team.

2.title: Adding Staff
2.description:
Click the 'Add Staff Member' button to create a new user. You'll need to provide their name, email, and assign a role.

Their initial password will be set automatically, and they will be required to change it on their first login.

3.title: Managing Staff
3.description: Use the actions menu (the three dots) on each row to edit a user's details, reset their password, or remove their account from the system.
